An active community focused on designing, building and implementing new solutions to transform people’s lives through social innovation and public entrepreneurship in key sectors.

Learn more

Who are we?

At the Tecnológico de Monterrey Graduate School of Government and Public Transformation, we believe that entrepreneurship is the way to trigger local, regional, and global development through the creation of platforms that lead to opportunities for better living conditions.

Therefore, on April 2015 we created LET, the Laboratory of Entrepreneurship and Transformation in which students and teachers get guidance, support, platforms, services and connections to help them build and launch successful projects that impact the world.

LET has the following objectives:

To foster an entrepreneurial ecosystem dedicated to public transformation and to contribute in the building of an innovation-based economy.

Develop initiatives that generate high social impact, intellectual property and knowledge transfer.

Attract top talented groups and individuals to the Graduate School of Government, including a community of entrepreneurs, academics, thinkers, developers and designers.

How do we work?

The LET community operates under a collaborative model that encourages transdisciplinary interaction with creative and innovative purposes. It believes that the effective union of diverse ideas, cultures, skills and disciplines of people with a common goal is a catalyst for productivity and innovation. It holds this as critical for the future of any country and organization.

LET has a flexible and adaptable work philosophy.

In LET, we encourage experimentation and even failure. To be bold and to think big is the prevailing mentality.

Programs

We contribute to the research projects of teachers in the School of Government and Public Transformation, developing tools for the analysis and dissemination of knowledge that, among other things, result in public enterprise.

Public Entrepreneurship for
Research Professors

We cultivate the ecosystem of public entrepreneurs and intrapreneurs. During a year, students work with a community of mentors and makers to develop prototypes, products, research tools, among others. They receive guidance to execute pilot tests and carry on field experiments, and they’re linked with partners or clients to launch their projects to the market.

Public Entrepreneurs
Society

We bring together talented people and entrepreneurs from around the world so that, within a week, they generate ideas and develop projects aimed at social transformation.

MECATE
International Public Entrepreneurship Program
